name: misfocus
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to not direct your attention or your efforts towards the right activity, subject, or problem; to direct your attention, etc. in the wrong way : Concentrating only on management styles misfocuses the debate. He was surprised that so many environmentalists emphasised population, saying that this was a misfocused argument. I think I just mis-focused. Related word
focus verb (CONCENTRATE)
More examplesFewer examplesThis was a very odd and misfocused debate, the consequences of which will remain for some years.We are required to act on every single piece of evidence, and this can often lead to misfocused efforts and a great deal of frustration.
